body_html:
@MarkDaoust Perhaps the tutorial Importing Data would be helpful for you.

import tensorflow as tf

dataset = (tf.data.Dataset.range(1, 6)
                          .apply(tf.contrib.data.sliding_window_batch(3, 1))
                          .batch(3))
iterator = dataset.make_one_shot_iterator()
next_element = iterator.get_next()

with tf.Session() as sess:
  res = sess.run(next_element)
  print(res)
# [[1 2 3]
#  [2 3 4]
#  [3 4 5]]

or

import tensorflow as tf

c = tf.map_fn(lambda x: tf.range(x, x+3), tf.range(1, 4))

with tf.Session() as sess:
  res = sess.run(c)
  print(res)

c = tf.map_fn(lambda x: tf.range(x, x+3), tf.range(1, 4))

with tf.Session() as sess:
  res = sess.run(c)
  print(res)
body:
@MarkDaoust Perhaps the tutorial [ Importing Data ](https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/programmers_guide/datasets) would be helpful for you.

```python
import tensorflow as tf

dataset = (tf.data.Dataset.range(1, 6)
                          .apply(tf.contrib.data.sliding_window_batch(3, 1))
                          .batch(3))
iterator = dataset.make_one_shot_iterator()
next_element = iterator.get_next()

with tf.Session() as sess:
  res = sess.run(next_element)
  print(res)
# [[1 2 3]
#  [2 3 4]
#  [3 4 5]]
```

or 

```python
import tensorflow as tf

c = tf.map_fn(lambda x: tf.range(x, x+3), tf.range(1, 4))

with tf.Session() as sess:
  res = sess.run(c)
  print(res)
```
